messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tsuba Theme
messages.msgSnippet: Rich and Curran, It s called omodaka. It is an unusual conception of the motif. Jim This is what Sasano calls Water Plantain . I don t know the japanese name.
messages.messageBody:
Rich and Curran,

It's called omodaka.

It is an unusual conception of the motif.

Jim



This is what Sasano calls 'Water Plantain'.
I don't know the japanese name. This one is highly
stylized, as if someone had macro-zoom focused on it.

In the last Sasano book, a classic example can be
found under Shoami Tsubas.

Curran



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
